conclusion: Plan to analyze the v-t graph to determine motion characteristics, focusing on acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.

The v-t graph has velocity on the vertical axis and time on the horizontal axis with three segments: 0-1s (velocity increases linearly), 1-2s (velocity increases quadratically), 2-3s (velocity decreases linearly).
Identify motion type: 0-1s shows constant acceleration, 1-2s shows non-constant acceleration, 2-3s shows constant deceleration.
Analyze acceleration: 0-1s has constant acceleration, 1-2s has non-constant acceleration due to quadratic velocity increase, 2-3s has constant negative acceleration.
Conclusion: The particle does not undergo linear motion with gradually decreasing acceleration from 1 to 2 seconds.
